snippet: A new anti-trafficking law has done little to end the illicit migrant trade in Agadez, a departure point for as many as 2,000 Africans a week.
abstract: More than half of West African migrants reaching Italy pass through Agadez, Niger, with as many as 2,000 arriving in the desert city each week; government's tough new anti-trafficking law has done little to end the lucrative migrant trade, which has become a bustling business right under the noses of country's law enforcement officers.
lead_paragraph: A new anti-trafficking law has done little to end the illicit migrant trade in Agadez, a departure point for as many as 2,000 Africans a week.

headline.main: Crackdown in Niger Fails to Deter Migrant Smugglers
headline.print_headline: Crackdown in Niger Fails to Deter Migrant Smugglers

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
